name: Careful Study
Rules: Play only if you have not moved this round. Investigate. You get +2 skill value for this investigation. If succeed, discover 1 additional clue. You cannot move until the end of the round.

name: Well Rested
Keywords:
Myriad. 
<vs>
Commit only after you've taken at least 2 actions during a round.
Rules: <fullname> lose <wild> for each for the following you have done this round: Moved, investigated, played a card, drawn a card.

name: Dedication
Rules:
Commit only to a test if you haven't committed cards this round.
<vs>
You cannot commit other cards until the end of the round.
<vs>
If this test is successful, draw 2 cards.
Flavor: Extra effort leads to better outcomes.

name: Crossbow
Rules: doesn't ready during upkeep. : Ready . If you are not committed to , you must pay as an additonal cost. When you could take an action, exhaust : Fight. You get +2 for this attack, and it deals +1 damage. This attack can target an enemy at a connecting location.
Flavor: Takes a bit of practice, but deadly in the right hands.

name: Smoke bombs
Rules: spend 1 ammo, exhaust : If your is 4 or higher: Fight. This attack deals deal +1 damage. Otherwise: Evade. Then if you are not engaged with an enemy, you may move to a connecting location.

name: Traveler's Cloak
Rules: You get +2 skill value to tests on or against hazards. 2 item cards in your hand don't count against your hand size.

name: Yak
Rules:
<fre> Exhaust <fullname>: Place any number of non-weakness cards from your hand beneat <fullname> facedown, or move any number of cards from beneath <fullname> to your hand. (Limit 5 cards beneath <fullname>)
<vs>
<for> After <fullname> takes damage: Discard X cards at random from beneath <fullname> where X is the amount of damage on <fullname>. If you cannot, <fullname> is defeated.

name: Safety Line
Keywords: Fast. Play when an investigator at a connecting location would be attacked.
Rules:
That investigator disengages all enemies, moves to your location, and cancel the attack.
<vs>
You get -2 <com> until the end of your next turn.
Flavor:
"Ach! Hans, run! It's the lhurgoyf!"
- Saffi Eriksdotter, last words

name: Bunker Down
Rules: If the effects of this test deals damage/horror to you, it deals 1 less damage and 1 less horror.

name: Hourglass of Chronos
Rules: <rea> When the investigator phase begins: You get -1 to all skills until the start of the next investigator phase. Gain 1 additional action this turn.

name: Throwing Daggers
Rules: Spend 1 supply: Fight. This attack ignores aloof and can target enemies on connecting locations. If you have 4 or more : This attack deals +1 damage. Otherwise use instead of for this attack.

name: Play dead
Rules:
Fast, play during your turn, play only if your <com> is 1 or less.
<vs>
Disengage all enemies. Until the start of your turn, you cannot move, enemies cannot engage or attack you, and the Hunter keyword does not take you into account.
<vs>
You get +2 <com> during your first fight action next turn.

name: Exhausting Effort
Rules:
After this test, put <fullname> into play under the performing investigators control.
<vs>
While <fullname> is in your play area you get -1 to all skills. 
<vs>
<for> At the start of your turn, discard <fullname> from your play area.

name: Henrik Vinkel
Rules:
<rea> When you test any skill, exhaust <fullname>: You get -1 skill value for this test. Place 1 Fate counter on <fullname>.
<vs>
<rea> When you test any skill, exhaust <fullname>: Remove X Fate counters from <fullname> to get +X skill value for this test.
Flavor: "Opening a savings account, are we?"

name: Reality Check
Rules:
Play under the control of an investigator at your location.
<vs>
You get -1 <wil>.
<vs>
<rea> When you would take horror, exhaust <fullname>: Cancel 1 horror just dealt.

name: Reality Check
Rules:
Play under the control of an investigator at your location.
<vs>
You get -1 <wil>.
<vs>
<rea> When you would take horror, exhaust <fullname>: Cancel 1 horror just dealt. If you have 0 <wil> ready <fullname>.

name: Weaving
Rules:
You cannot play <fullname> while your commitment to <mys> is less than 2.
<vs>
<rea> When your turn begins, if you are committed to a class that isn't <mys>: Place 1 charge on an asset at your location.

name: Fated Ward
Rules: <rea> When resolving a non-<ten> symbol token, during a test with a higher difficulty than your base skill value, exhaust <fullname>: Ignore the non-modifier effects of that token.
Flavor: Fortune favors the bold and the blessed.

name: Union Rights
Keywords: Fast, play after another investigator at your location defeats an enemy.
Rules:
Gain 4 resources.
<vs>
<for> If you defeat an enemy while <fullname> is in your hand: Discard it, then gain 2 resource.
Flavor: "Look man, it's a hazard to work double shifts."

name: Sidearm
Rules: When you add to your deck, name a Firearm. If you have exactly 1 copy of the named card in your deck, it starts in play. When the named card enters play: Place 2 ammo on it. When resolving abilities on the named card: You get +1 to all skills during that ability.

name: The Colt
Rules: Ammo cannot be placed on this card after it has entered play. Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +3 for this attack, and deal +2 damage. If this attack succeeds against a non-elite enemy, you may spend 1 ammo to defeat that enemy.

name: Flexibility
Rules: <rea> During the upkeep phase, when you would draw 1 card: Instead draw 1 card for each different basic action you've taken this round.
Flavor:
"They're both for monsters."
- Geralt of Rivia, on his two swords.

name: Flexibility
Rules:
<rea> During the upkeep phase, when you would draw 1 card: Instead draw 1 card for each different basic action you've taken this round.
<vs>
<rea> After you fail a basic action during your turn, exhaust <fullname>: You cannot take any more actions of the failed type this turn. Take an action.

name: Brutality
Rules: <for> When you succeed on a basic fight action against an enemy engaged with another investigator, exhaust <fullname>: This attack deals +1 damage.

name: Baton
Rules: : Fight. You get +1 for this attack. This attack deals +1 damage. : Return to your hand.

name: Stashed Ration
Rules:
<rea> After you draw <fullname>: You may discard this card to heal 2 damage.
<vs>
Heal 3 damage. Heal 1 damage from each asset you control.
Flavor: Enough to go around.

name: Stashed Ration
Rules:
<rea> After you draw <fullname>: You may discard this card to heal 1 damage.
<vs>
Heal 3 damage.
Flavor: Expires soon.

name: Jake Argyle
InvStoryBack: Something something science, using self as test subject, girlfriend Athena went missing, very tragic, clue points towards some guy "Neff" - very ominous.
Text3Back: Survivor cards () level 0-5, Neutral cards level 0-5, Science cards level 0-3 and up to 5 Seeker cards () level 0
Text4Back: 4 different copies of Serum, Addiction, 1 random basic weakness.
Subtitle: Altered beast
Text5Back: You begin each game with 4 copies of Serum set aside, out of play.
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules:
<rea> When you turn begins: Put one of your set-aside Serum cards it into play.
<lvs>
<eld> effect: +0, after this test you may set aside a Withdrawal or Serum card from play.

name: Chimaeric formula
Keywords:
Jake Argyle deck only.
<vs>
Fast. Play during any <fre> window.
Rules:
Set aside any number of Serum and Withdrawal cards from play.
<vs>
You may search your bonded cards for up to two Serum cards and put them into play.

name: Serum
RulesBack:
You cannot discover clues or evade enemies. 
<vs>
<for> At the end of the Mythos phase: Set this card aside out of play.
Subtitle: Strength
Rules:
You get +4 <com>.
<vs>
Your basic fight actions deal 1 additional damage.
<vs>
<for> At the start of the Investigator phase: Flip over this card.

name: Serum
RulesBack:
You cannot move. 
<vs>
You automatically fail all <agi> tests.
<vs>
<for> At the end of the Mythos phase: Set this card aside out of play.
Subtitle: Agility
Rules:
You get +2 <agi>.
<vs>
<rea> After you evade an enemy at your location: Choose a connecting location. You may move your investigator and/or that enemy to that location.
<vs>
<for> At the end of your turn, flip over this card.

name: Serum
RulesBack:
The first treachery you draw each round gains Surge.
<vs>
<for> At the end of the Mythos phase: Set this card aside out of play.
Subtitle: Willpower
Rules:
You get +3 <wil>.
<vs>
<rea> When you take any amount damage and/or horror: Reduce that by 1 damage or horror.
<vs>
<rea> When you fail a skill test: You fail by 2 less.
<vs>
<for> At the start of the Investigator phase: Flip over this card.

name: Serum
RulesBack:
<for> When you fail a skill test, take 1 direct horror.
<vs>
<for> At the end of the Mythos phase: Set this card aside out of play.
Subtitle: Intellect
Rules:
You get +1 <int>.
<vs>
<rea> When you succeed by 2 or more while investigating, exhaust <fullname>: Draw 1 card and gain 1 resource.
<vs>
<for> At the start of the Investigator phase: Flip over this card.

name: Addiction
Rules: <rev> At the beginning of your next turn, search your bonded cards for 2 random Serum cards and put them into play Withdrawal side face-up.

name: Tim Elderman
InvStoryBack: The old man is not entirely sure how he got back. What he does know, is that the world is surely doomed unless he can fix it. But how? He knows so much, but none of that was of any help the first time around. What do you make of your knowledge, when all you know is how to fail?
Text3Back: Seeker cards (<see>) level 0-5, Cards of the chosen class level 0. Neutral cards level 0-5.
Subtitle: Temporal Refugee
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Text8Back:
If a card has multiple versions, you can only add it to your deck by upgrading. When you upgrade a card in your deck, you must do it by swapping a card in your deck with a card from your Future deck. (Paying the usual xp cost for upgrading.)
(You're allowed to add otherwise illegal cards to your deck this way, and leave level 0 cards in your Future Deck.)
Text6Back: Cards of any classes level 1-5 that has lower level versions present in your deck.
Text7Back: You start the game with 20 xp that can only be used on the Future Deck. After each scenario, you get 2 xp to spend on your Future Deck.
Rules:
<rea> when you would play or commit a card: You may remove that card from the game to play or commit a card with the same name from your Future deck instead.
<vs>
<eld>: +2, heal 1 horror.

name: The Journal
Rules:
<fullname> can be investigated as if it was a location you were currently on. Shroud is equal to the number of resouces on it.
Clues on <fullname> are not controlled by you.
<vs>
<fre> if <fullname> has fewer than 3 clues on it, exhaust <fullname>: Move a clue from your current location to <fullname>. Add resources to <fullname> up to the shroud value of your current location.
<vs>
<rea> When you discover the last clue from <fullname>: Remove all resources from <fullname>.
Subtitle: The story so far...

name: Tim Elderman
Subtitle: Past Self
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules:
<fre> discard a card beneath Past Self: Draw a card. 
<vs>
<rea> When you play a card: Reduce its cost by 2 to place it facedown beneath your Future Self. (Limit once per round)
<vs>
<eld>: +1, and you may look at top 3 cards of your deck. Place them on top or bottom of your deck in any order.

name: Tim Elderman
Subtitle: Future Self
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules:
<fre>: Play a card from beneath Future Self ignoring it's cost.
<vs>
<fre>: Place a card from your hand beneath your Past Self. (Limit once per round)
<vs>
You may use resources and cards on hand from your Past Self, as if it were your resources/hand.
<vs>
<eld>: +0, and after this test you may swap to Past Self.

name: Future Deck
RulesBack: <rea> When you would play a card: You may search the Future deck for a card with the same name, swap the two and play the other one instead. When you play a card this way, take direct horror equal to the level of the played card.
RulesA:
When spending xp, you may upgrade a card in your deck to a higher level version of the card in the Future Deck. Do this by spending the difference in xp, and swapping the two cards.
You may do this even if either deck could normally not include those cards.

You may add cards to your Future Deck using the normal rules for deck building, but you may only use the bonus xp as denoted on Tim Elderman.

name: Dr. Abraham Belmont
InvStoryBack:
There are those who investigate the strange occurrences in the world. Those who seek out, investigate, delve and ponder. 
And then there are those who know, those who fight.
Abraham, brought up in the Belmont clan in eastern Europe know the darkness far too well. Nothing is easy when you're part of a cursed lineage, but at least he doesn't have to face the coming evil unprepared. But how well can one prepare for that which the human mind cannot comprehend?
Text3Back: Guardian cards () level 0-5. Mystic cards () level 0-2. Spell cards with "Fight" level 0-5. Neutral cards level 0-5.
Text4Back: Bane slayer, A Vision Of Those We Failed, a random basic weakness.
Flavor: "What is a man...?"
Subtitle: Vampire Hunter
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules:
<rea> When you defeat an enemy: If you are committed to <mys> gain <rec>. If you are committed to <gua> replenish 1 charge on an asset at your location.
<vs>
<eld>: +1. Choose any number of classes. You are considered committed to those classes until the end of the round.

name: Bane Slayer
Rules: Abraham Belmonts deck only. : Fight. You get +0 and deal +1 damage for this attack. While you are committed to change the above 0 to 2 and add "you deal no damage on a failed test." While you are committed to change the above 1 to 2 and add "you may ignore keywords that would trigger during this test."
Subtitle: Relic of Clan Belmont

name: A Vision Of Those We Failed
Rules:
<rev> If you are committed to <gua> take 2 direct <dmg>. If you are committed to <mys> take 2 direct <hor>.
<vs>
If you took no damage or horror, shuffle <fullname> into your deck and you have 1 fewer actions next turn.
Flavor: "You're a bane upon my existence Belmont!"

name: Victoria Colt
Text3Back: Guardian cards (<gua>) level 0-3, Cards with "Uses (Ammo)" level 0-5, Up to 10 Survior and/or Rogue cards (<sur>/<rog>) level 0-1.
Subtitle: The Gunsmith
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules:
<rea> When your turn begins: Replenish 1 Ammo on a non-story asset you control. Triggered abilities on that asset can't used this turn.
<lvs>
<eld> effect: +2, replenish 1 ammo on a non-story asset at your location.

name: Personal Project
Rules: Search your discard pile or deck for a Firearm asset and draw it. You may put it in to play ignoring its cost and Uses (X) keyword. If you did not, you may play it paying its cost.

name: Rust to Rust
Rules: <rev> For each non-story asset you control with uses, remove all tokens of that type from that asset. If 2 or fewer tokens were removed this way, shuffle <fullname> into your deck.

name: Temporal Backtrack
Rules:
<rea> When you fail a skill test during your turn, exhaust <fullname>:
<bultab><bul> If your <agi> is 3 or higher: You gain an addtional action this turn.
<bultab><bul> If your <agi> is 3 or lower: Cancel all effects of this test.
Flavor: Yes, I'm sure... this time.

name: Temporal Backtrack
Rules:
<rea> When you fail a skill test during your turn, exhaust <fullname>:
<bultab><bul> If your <agi> is 4 or higher: You gain an addtional action this turn..
<bultab><bul> If your <agi> is 2 or lower: Cancel all effects of this test.
Flavor: Yes, I'm sure... this time.

name: Warding Relic
Rules: When a non-weakness treachery would be put into the play area of an investigator at your location, discard : Discard that card instead. (You still resolve other effects on that card)
Flavor: Old and fragile, but it seems like the real deal.

name: Improvisation
Rules:
Commit only if the skill being tested is the lowest skill of the performing investigator.
<vs>
If this test is successful, draw 1 card.

name: Rasmus Dane
InvStoryBack: The press told a story of children going missing. Rasmus knew he had to do something. Not so much because of the children, but the reward was big, and rumor had it that they had been taken to a nearby castle - and castles are usually filled with potential "merchandise", regardless of how creepy the owner is.
Text3Back: Rogue cards (<rog>) level 0-5, Cards with "succeed by" level 0-4, Neutral cards level 0-5.
Flavor: Watch this!
Subtitle: Show-off
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules:
<rea> At the start of the investigator phase: You get +2 to all skills until the next investigator phase. 
<vs>
<for> When a skill test you perform ends, if your modified skill value is not the highest since the start of the above effect, the effect ends.
<vs>
<eld>: +2, the above forced ability can't trigger this round.

name: Hubris
Rules:
Put <fullname> into your threat area.
<vs>
When you would succeed at a test, if you don't succeed by at least X, you fail by 0 instead. Otherwise, put 1 resource on <name> as a token.
<vs>
X is the number of tokens on <name>
<vs>
<act><act><act>: Discard <name>, reduce this ability's cost by <act> for each test you've succeeded this turn.

name: Showboating
Rules:
Rasmus Dane deck only.
<vs>
<rea> After another investigator at your location fails a skill test, exhaust <fullname>: You attempt that test again, as if it were your test. If you don't succeed by at least 2, lose 2 resources.
Flavor: "Let me show you how it's done!"

name: Poe
Text3Back: Survivor cards (<sur>) level 0-5. Mystic cards (<mys>) level 0-2. Neutral cards level 0-5.
Subtitle: Haunted Poet
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules:
You get +1 <int> for each encounter card in your hand and threat area.
<vs>
<rea> When you would draw a card from the encounter deck: Look at the top 3 cards and draw 1 of them instead. Shuffle the encounter deck.
<vs>
<eld> effect: +2. After this test resolves, you may take an action on or against a card in your threat area.

name: Bonum Dolor
Rules: <rea> When you would provoke an attack of opportunity from a non-elite enemy: Cancel that attack. You cannot evade that enemy this round, and player effects cannot make you disengage from that enemy.
Flavor:
"All suffering originates from craving,
from attachment, from desire."

name: Nevermore
Rules:
Other enemies at <fullname>s location gains massive. <vs>
Test on treacheries at <fullname>s location get +1 difficulty.
Flavor:
"And his eyes have all the seeming
of a demon’s that is dreaming"

name: Mina Halcombe
Text3Back: Seeker cards (<see>) level 0-5. Rogue cards (<rog>) level 0-2. Neutral cards level 0-5.
Subtitle: Eavesdropper
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules: Your investigate actions can target connected locations. As an additional cost to discover any number of clues from your location, you must spend 2 resources. +1. You may move a clue from your current location to a connecting location.

name: The Journal
Rules:
<rea> When you discover a clue from a location with a ready enemy, exhaust <fullname>: Place 1 evidence on <fullname>.
<vs>
<rea> When a non-elite enemy would engage an investigator at your location, spend 2 evidence: Instead, move that enemy to a connecting location.

name: Count Fosco
Keywords:
Aloof. Elusive. Hunter. 
<vs>
<pre> Mina Halcombe only.
Rules: While <fullname> is ready, clues cannot be discovered from locations connected to his location.

name: George Orwell
Flavor: Dare to think.
Subtitle: The Critic
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules: When you would search the top or bottom of a deck: Search the top or bottom of a deck belonging to an investigator at your location instead. (Any cards drawn enters the hand of the owner) +1. Search the top card of your deck for a card and draw it.

name: Sudden Storm
Rules: If you control 2 or fewer items, shuffle into your deck. Otherwise attach to a connecting location (revealed and empty if possible). Lose control of each item you control, and attach them to . : Gain control of an item you own, attached to .

name: Astrid Olsen
Text2Back: Pick either Seeker (<see>), Guardian (<gua>) or Rogue (<rog>).
InvStoryBack:
<name> didn't expect to find herself in this situation. Luckily she already had her gear with her, which should be enough to last through... whatever this was.
Pack light, move fast, avoid bad weather, wear dry socks. Every explorer knew this.
Text3Back: Survivor cards () level 0-5. Items of the chosen class taking up 1 or more slots level 0-5. Neutral cards level 0-5.
Text4Back: Fjällräven, Sudden Storm, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "First rule of the mountain: Everything can burn if the alternative is freezing."
Subtitle: The Mountaineer
Text5Back: The cards in your deck may not take up more slots than you have. You are considered to have all slots granted by cards in your deck for this purpose.
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Text6Back: Footwear and masks loses "limit 1" and instead takes up a Footwear or Mask slot respectively. You have 1 of each of those slot.
Rules: You start the game with Fjällräven in play. If it's your turn: Move. Your destination must have a higher shroud value than your current location. (Limit once per round) +2. Ready Fjällräven.

name: Astrid Olsen
CustText1: Fjällräven gains "You have 1 additional hand slot."
CustText2: Fjällräven gains "You have 1 additional accessory slot."
CustHeader: You can mark at most 10 checkboxes.
CustText3: Fjällräven gains "You have 2 additional body slot."
CustText4: Fjällräven gains "<act> Exhaust Fjällräven: Play a card attached to Fjällräven at -2 resource cost."
CustText5: For deckbuilding purposes, you are considered to have 1 more of each equipment slot.
CustText6: You may include up to 5 other level 0 cards from your secondary class.
CustText7: Fjällräven's <fre> ability now searches the top 3 cards instead.
CustText8: Your allies gains the item trait. (This includes for deckbuilding purposes, while in your deck, in play or anywhere else.)

name: Fjällräven
Rules: Exhaust : Search the top card of your deck for an item and attach it facedown to . Draw each weakness. Place the rest on bottom of your deck. You may play cards attached to as if they were in your hand.

name: Cursed
Rules:
<rev> Add Cursed to your threat area.

You're cursed.

When you would draw an encounter card during the mythos phase, instead search the encounter deck for the top-most enemy and non-enemy cards, then draw both.

name: Vampire Thrall
Rules: <for> When <fullname> deals damage, heal that much damage from it.

name: Vampires
AccentedStoryA: During the Day, exposed, outside and X locations are considered "sunlit". While hunting, vampires cannot enter sunlit locations. Any Vampire in a sunlit location immediately takes 1 damage, then moves one location towards the nearest non-sunlit location. Repeat this process until the vampire is defeated or reaches a non-sunlit location.

name: Blood Fang
Rules: <fullname> has aloof during the investigator phase.
Flavor: Wings of torn leather, the face of a mutilated primate and the aggression of a starving wolf.

name: Ludvig Von Kurva
Flavor: This is a long bit</fs> of t<fs>ext to try crap in
Subtitle: Aspirering Arcanist

name: Arcane Sigil
Rules:
<rev> Attach to the location with the highest shroud without a sigil.
<vs>
<for> At the end of the round, place 1 Blood token on <fullname>.
<vs>
<act>: Test <wil>(5) to discard <fullname>.

name: Cultist
Rules: <for> When the Enemy phase ends, if <fullname> shares location with an Arcane Sigil, is ready and unengaged: Discard <fullname> and place 2 Blood tokens on the Arcane Sigil.

name: The Sightless Facade
Keywords: Attached elite enemy gains "Forced - When dealing damage to an investigator: Heal 1 damage."

name: The Dusken Cuirass
Keywords: Attached Elite enemy gains "Forced - When taking any amount of damage: Reduce that damage by 1."

name: The Bloody Aegis
Keywords: Attached elite enemy gains "Forced - When successfully attacked: This enemy retaliates unless the test succeeded by 2 or more."

name: The Quickened Death
Keywords: Attached elite enemy gains "Can retaliate even if exhausted. Gains +1 fight value."

name: Squire
Rules: When is defeated: Set it aside out of play. Any attached equipment is attached to the current location face-up.
Flavor:
Sworn to do their masters bidding,
with blind and deadly effeciency.

name: Dario Menthas
Subtitle: The Templar
SubtitleBack: First Blade of The Vampire Knights
Rules: If all equipment story assets in play are attached to , flip Dario and immediately advance to Character Agenda 2b.
FlavorBack:
"I am the bloody vengance of the moon, 
come to vanquish the light of day.
my falling on sword may be needed soon,
but until then, you and I will play!"

name: Delayed transport
AccentedStoryABack: The cult has discovered you, and is now scrambling to advance their ritual.
AgendaStory: Something is going on here, but whatever it is, it seems we've arrived early. No one has noticed us yet.
RulesABack: Check the campaign guide, and perform the remaining setup (setup part 2) for Dario.
Rules: <for> At the beginning of the mythos phase: Place 1 doom on this agenda.

name: Armaments of the Night
AccentedStoryABack:
Two curdled screams fills the air for a split second, until a flash of followed by a roaring thunder drowns it out.
The ritual is done. You were too late.
AgendaStory: The servants are carrying around boxes. It seems they're all going towards the head cultist. Whatever they're up to can't be good, and it seems like you don't have much time to save the girl.
RulesABack: Remove the victim from the game. Note in the Campaign log that the victim died.
Rules: All Squires gain "Patrol - Dario's location." If a Squire reaches Dario, attach any equipment on the location to Dario and set the Squire aside out of play.

name: The Dark Knight rises
AccentedStoryABack: With the girl rescued, the cultists can no longer hurt her. However, you suddenly hear a blood curdling scream, sending a shiver down your spine.
AgendaStory: You were too late. Dario completed the ritual and the girl is dead. While catching the culprits would be nice, there are other girls to rescue before it's too late.
RulesABack:
Flip Dario. Remove all Squires from the game. (They can no longer spawn)
<vs>
While there are Equipment in play attached to locations, Dario gains "Patrol - Nearest equipment" and loses Hunter. When Dario enters a location with Equipment, attach it to Dario.
Rules: All Squires get "Patrol - Nearest Investigator." and +1 attack.

name: Shadows in the Village
Skull: -1 for every 2 Leads and Insights you have.

name: Winning Trust
AccentedStoryABack: The locals seem scared. You don't speak the language, and yet the angst is almost palatable. Yet it appears that people talk, and someone approaches you and slip you a note with some cryptic marks. You're not quite sure what to make of it, but it appears to be part of a plan to attack the village.
ActStory: Most of the villagers looks as if scared and tired. I'm not sure why. We'd better get to work - missing person cases are usually a race against the clock.
AccentedStoryBBack:
The locals seem scared. You don't speak the language, and yet the angst is almost palatable. You're a stranger in a village in turmoil. The nights are long and harrowing, and the days are chill and desolate.
These are going to be some long weeks.
Rules: If "you bought a map": Look at the revealed side of any outside location. When the investigators have collected 3 leads, immediately advance.

name: Acting fast
AccentedStoryABack: Time to get moving. There's always a trade off between timeliness and thoroughness, let's just hope you made the right call.
ActStory: You have a rough idea about where some of the girls might have been taken, but it wouldn't hurt to have a few more details.
Rules: If "you bought a map": Look at the revealed side of any outside location. At the end of round, if all surviving investigators are at the same location, you may advance. (The more Leads and Insight you gather, the better, but time is a factor too.)

name: Burning the candle. (Night)
AccentedStoryABack: A long night. But the girls can't wait. We had to do something.
AgendaStory: It's clear this village has it's fair share of problems with trouble makers. Better find shelter for the night. On the other hand - those girls needs us to keep pushing on..
Rules:
Enemies cannot enter inside locations. Enemies that would spawn on inside locations spawn on the nearest outside location instead.
<vs>
If all investigators are asleep, immediately advance.
RulesBBack: Any investigators that didn't sleep through the night must discard 3 cards from their hand. Discard all Nocturnal cards from play.
HeaderABack: If any investigators are still awake, read the following:

name: The search begins.
AccentedStoryABack: As night falls, you suddenly realise that everybody is gone. Of course, people usually stay at home during the night, but this... this is almost like they're hiding. From what? Then you feel it. Like a tingling down you spine. You can almost taste the evil intent in the air. The shadows are observing you.
AgendaStory: Most of the villagers look at us with suspicion and mistrust. Some with fear... I'm not sure why. We'd better get to work - missing person cases are usually a race against the clock.
RulesABack: Remember that during the night, the Night Deck is considered the encounter deck. Remember to mark the calendar in the campaign log.
AccentedStoryBBack: Uneasy dreams haunt your sleep, but that's probably just the stress of the job.
RulesBBack: Remember to mark the calendar in the campaign log.

name: Clouded skies (Day)
AccentedStoryABack: Nightfall. Like last night people seem to suddenly vanish from the streets. Locked doors. Lights off. Borded up windows. A cloud of winged teeth approaches, silhouetted by the pale winter moon...
AgendaStory: Tired, scared faces walk the street today. You see doors being locked tightly every time people leave or enter their homes. Better make sure you've got a place to be tonight, if you're staying around.
RulesABack:
Put the set aside Carmilla enemy into play at Town Square.
<vs>
Shuffle the set aside Bats encounter set into the Night deck.

name: Clouded skies (Night)
AccentedStoryABack: Morning is here. The dawn breaks the night. There are surprisingly few signs left of the nights struggles.
AgendaStory:
Darkness covers the skies, dark wings covers the skies, and wild animals are roaming the streets.
A smart person would stay inside locked doors this night.
RulesABack: If Carmilla is still alive, set her aside out of play. Discard all Nocturnal cards from play. Any investigator that didn't sleep through the night takes 1 and 1 . Reset the agenda deck to Agenda 3a: Clouded Skies (Day).

name: Carmilla
Rules: <for> At the end of the enemy phase, if Carmilla is unengaged and ready: Reveal the top card of the Night deck. If it's an enemy, spawn it at Carmilla's location.

name: Poison?
Rules: <rev> Test <wil> (3) to not take <dmg>. If you fail by 3, take <hor>.
Flavor: Oh, my stomach... what did I eat last night?

name: Obstruction
Rules:
<rev> Determine two locations: The nearest location with clues, and one with the most clues among the rest.
Add 1 clue to each location, then distribute the clues on those locations as evenly as possible.
Flavor: "Something doesn't add up..."

name: Mistrust
Rules:
<rev> Attach to nearest inside location without an investigator. Attached location cannot be entered.
<vs>
<act>: Test <wil> (2) or <int> (3) to discard <fullname>. Investigators can trigger this ability from connecting locations.

name: Bad Omens
Rules: <rev> Test <wil> (2) to not take <hor><hor>. If you fail by exactly 1, also lose <rec>.

name: Thief
Rules:
<for> When <fullname> spawns: Chose an asset you control, lose control of it and attach it to <fullname> facedown. If you can't, move <fullname> to your location, engages and attacks you.
<vs>
<for> When <fullname> is defeated: Return any attached assets to their owners control.

name: Wild dogs
Flavor: Quite dangerous. Luckily they're easily scared off.

name: Stressing out
Rules:
You must choose one: 
<bul> Discard 2 cards
<bul> Choose another investigator to discard 1 card at random.

name: Blood Cultist
Rules:
<for> When <fullname> attacks, place 1 clue on its location.
<vs>
<for> At the end of the enemy phase, if <fullname> didn't attack this round: Place 1 clue on its location.

name: Drowzy Evils
Rules:
<rev> You must choose one:
<vs>
<bul> If you're inside: You fall asleep.
<bul> Place 1 doom on the current agenda. This may cause the agenda to advance.
<vs>
Set <fullname> aside. At the end of the mythos phase, shuffle it back into the Night Deck.

name: Frozen Limbs
Rules:
<rev> Put <fullname> into your threat area. 
<vs>
As an additional cost to move, investigate or fight while outside, take <dmg>.
<vs>
<act> If you're inside: Discard <fullname>.

name: Unnatural chill
Rules:
<rev> If you're outside, take 3 <dmg>. Otherwise, take <dmg>.
<vs>
You may exhaust a <t>clothing</t> asset to reduce the damage taken by 1.

name: Outlaw
Keywords: <spa> Nearest outside location with an unengaged investigator if possible, otherwise nearest outside location.
Rules: When <fullname> deals damage to you, discard an asset you control, then discard Outlaw.

name: Night Watcher
Rules: If there's no Criminal or Illicit cards at this or connecting locations: Parley. Test (3) to discard .

name: Unnatural Shadows
Rules:
<rev> Attach to the agenda.
<vs>
All outside locations get +1 shroud.

name: Strange Gust
Rules: Attach to nearest inside location. Investigators at that location takes . Attached location is considered outside. (It loses inside and gains outside) : Discard .

name: Town Square
Flavor:
Most people in town will sooner or later pass by here.
A bit of trust will go a long way.
Rules: <fre> When you investigate this location, spend any number of  clues: Reduce shroud by that amount for this test.

name: The Church
Flavor: The old church stands proud and tall. It's gives off that humbling feeling one gets from witnessing the great works of the past.
Rules: <act> If there are no clues on <fullname>: <cod> 1.

name: Tunnel
Subtitle: North
Rules: <fre> If there are no clues on this location: <cod> 4.

name: Tunnel
Subtitle: Center
Rules: <fre> If there are no clues on this location: <cod> 5.

name: Tunnel
Subtitle: South
Rules: <fre> If there are no clues on this location: <cod> 6.

name: Raven Hotel
RulesBack: Raven Hotel cannot be entered at night.
Flavor:
"Then this ebony bird beguiling 
my sad fancy into smiling"
<right>- Edgar Allan Poe
Rules: Spend : Sleep. If there are no clues on , spend clues: Call upon the services of the concierge 7.

name: Hospital
Rules: If you have 4 or more / on cards you control: Seek medical treatment 2.

name: Post Office
Flavor: It might be a good idea to request additional resources from the agency.

name: Ionescu's Home
Flavor: The Ionescus are willing to let you sleep on the couch.
Rules: If there are no clues on this location: 3. This location is considered Inside and Safe until you leave. (Max 1 active effect)

name: Concierge Stefania
Rules: Spend : Remeber that "you bought a map". Spend : Hire a taxi Move to any revealed outside location.
Flavor: "Hello. How might I help you today?"

name: Nikita
Rules: : Place 1 of your clues on Nikita. (If you control a Medic, place up to 3) If there are 2 clues on Nikita: 8
Subtitle: Nurse

name: A picnic in the wild
AgendaStory: You've arrived at the forest "Pădurea Pierdută". It seems like a place that would be nice to visit when not actively trying to find a hidden kidnapper. Right now, it just seems huge.
Rules: After you move from one Woods location to another a Woods location: Test (4) to not become Lost.

name: Fleeman
Rules:
<for> When <fullname> attacks: Move the attacked investigator once towards The Creature.
<vs>
<for> After successfully attacking or evading <fullname>: Move one location towards The Creature.
Flavor: "Legs like springs, and claws like knifes - yet their penchant for making you loose your footing is by far their deadliest trait." - Annals of Clan Belmont

name: The Creature
Rules:
<for> Readies at the beginning of the enemy phase.
<vs>
<for> If <fullname> would be defeated: Instead remove all damage from it. Exhaust it. It cannot ready until the end of the round.

name: The Vila
AccentedStoryABack:
Suddenly, a wall slides in front of the stairs and you hear a scraping mechanical sound like stone grinding and wood creaking, like rooms shifting around.
<vs>
Before gathering your thoughts however, the lights flicker violently and you hear a deep rumbling groan coming from upstairs.
RulesABack: Put the set aside The Creature into play at the Laboratory.
ActStory: You've found the Vila the locals talked about. You see a technical construction on the roof, with wires going down into a window on the second floor.
Rules: <for> After an investigator enters the Foyer, advance.
HeaderABack:
Check the campaign guide, <cod> 1.
<vs>
After that, read:

name: The Basement
AccentedStoryABack: Finally. You dial the combination, pull the lever, and the secret wall opens up. You can enter the basement now.
RulesABack: For the rest of the game, the Basement Stairs location is connected to the location with the secret entrance.
ActStory: The girl must be in the basement. And basic logic dictates that the entrance to the basement must still be on the ground floor.
Rules: If there are no clues on your location: Resolve the card under your location. Spend 2 clues: Look at the card under your location without resolving it. (You'll be told when to advance)

name: Escape the Vila
ActStory:
LVS
<lvs>
SVS
<svs>
VS
<vs>
Empty line

End of test

name: Bridge, West
RulesBack: Bridge locations can only be entered from locations they are connected to. This only affects investigators.
Rules: Bridge locations can only be entered from locations they are connected to. This only affects investigators.

name: Tricky Mechanism
Rules: Spend 2 clues: Remember that you "figured out the mechanism". If you've figured out the mechanism: Flip the and locations.

name: Heavy Mechanism
Rules:
<act><act>: Flip the <locstar> and <locquest> locations. 
Then test <com> (4) to gain an action.

name: Hill Camp
Flavor: "Safe" is a relative word, but if you put out the fire, the camp is hidden enough, and probably far enough away from the waters, to attract attention.
Rules: Investigators sleeping at this location is considered to be inside.
FlavorBack: From the road you saw a small camp up the steep muddy hills. You better find the long way around if you want to get up there.

name: The Road
Rules: : Resign. We have to leave this place.

name: Koholint Island
Rules: If there are no clues on : Remember that you "found a buried treasure".

name: Mitchell Wayne
InvStoryBack:
Life was actually pretty good for Mitchell. That was, until the day the whispers started. "Pick it up!" they said. "Keep it. You'll need it later" they reassured.
So far, it looked like the voices were looking out for him.
Text3Back: Survivor cards (<sur>) level 0-5. <t>Upgrade</t> cards level 0-3. Neutral cards level 0-5. Two non-permanent assets of any class level 0-5.
Subtitle: Guided
Text5Back: You must have exactly 2 assets without the Permanent keyword in your deck.
Keywords: <rea> if you would fail a test on an asset you control by 1 or less, you succeed by 0 instead.
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Text6Back: Your 2 non-permanent assets start in play. Your starting resources is 2.
Rules: <eld> effect: +2, after this test ready each asset you control.

name: Guided
Rules: <fre> exhaust <fullname>: Choose an asset controlled by another investigator at your location. Swap control of that asset and an asset you control. You get +2 to all skills while resolving abilities on the chosen asset this turn.
Flavor:
"Uhh... My umbrella for your paper good sir? What?
No reason, I just don't mind the rain..."
Subtitle: Whispers from beyond

name: Attachments
Keywords:
Mitchell Wayne deck only.
<vs>
<rev> Put <fullname> into your threat area.
Rules:
Treat the text box of non-story assets you control as blank.
<vs>
<fre> Discard cards from hand, spend resources and take direct damage in any combination totalling 6: Discard <name>.
Flavor:
"Leave... it...!"
"You... need... to... leave... now!"

name: Nicole Cramer
Text3Back: Guardian cards level 0-5. Neutral cards level 0-5. Ally cards level 0-3.
Text4Back: The Conspiracy, Agents, 5 copies of Manipulated
Subtitle: Ex-communicato
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>

name: The Conspiracy
Rules: <for> When you draw an <t>ally</t> card, put it into play at a connecting location, and attach a set-aside copy of Manipulated to it. If you cannot, take 1 damage instead.

name: Manipulated
Rules:
X is the cost of the attach Ally.
<vs>
<fullname> deals damage/horror equal to the health/sanity of the attached Ally.
<vs>
<rea> When <fullname> would leave play: Set aside <fullname> outside of play, then gain control of the attached Ally.

name: Frank Reinhart
Text3Back: Guardian cards () level 0-3, Mystic cards () level 0-3, a single copy of up to 5 other Weapon or Spell cards level 0-5.
Text4Back: Aura of Iron Will, Compulsive Planning, 1 random basic weakness.
Subtitle: Monster hunter
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules:
<for> When you play an asset: That asset do not enter play with charges.
<vs>
<fre> Draw the top card of the encounter deck: Replenish up to 3 charges on an asset on your location or ignore the above ability the next time it would trigger this round.
<lvs>
<eld> effect: +2, if this is a test on or against an encounter card, draw a card.

name: Aura of Iron Will
Rules:
<rea> During a test on or against an encounter card, spend 2 charges from among assets you control: You get +3 skill value for this test.
<vs>
<rea> When you draw an encounter card during your turn, exhaust <fullname>: Draw 1 card.

name: Compulsive Planning
Rules: Put into your threat area. The first encounter card you draw each round gains Surge. Discard a Spell card, a Weapon card and a skill card from your hand: Discard .

name: Saga
Text3Back: Rogue cards 0-5. Neutral cards 0-5.
Subtitle: The Twins
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules: You can only play, commit and trigger cards from Saga's location. When you perform a Move action, if you have at least as many cards in play as cards: Falke may take a Move action. (limit 1 per round) effect: +1, if you succeed you may discover a clue at Falke's location.

name: Falke
Text3Back: Survivor Cards 0-5. Neutral cards 0-5.
Subtitle: The Twins
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules: You can only play, commit and trigger cards from Falke's location. When you perform a Play action, if you have at least as many cards in play as cards: Saga may take a Play action. (limit 1 per round) effect: +1, if you succeed Saga may move to a connecting location.

name: Soul Link
Rules:
The Twins deck only.
<vs>
Damage/horror that would be placed on Saga is placed on Falke instead. If either of the twins are defeated, they are both defeated.
<vs>
The last twin to spend an action will be the one to draw a card during both upkeep and mythos phase.
<vs>
The Twins share a hand, clue and resource pool.

name: Dexter Drake
InvStoryBack: Dexter Drake returned from the Great War to become a successful magician, enthralling audiences with his elaborate illusions and cunning stage tricks. Despite his meteoric success, Dexter still felt a calling to fight for others. Like with so many of his comrades, the war never left Dexter. Using tricks and stage play, Dexter now often ruffle with the likes of the O'Banions to make Arkham a better place.
Text3Back: Mystic cards (<mys>) level 0-4, Cards that takes up at least 1 hand slot with <act> abilities level 0-3, Neutral cards level 0-5, and up to 10 Rogue cards (<rog>) level 0.
Text4Back: Showmanship, Occult Scraps, 1 random basic weakness.
Flavor: "True magic? Such a thing does not exist."
Subtitle: The Magician
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules: Play actions you perform do not provoke attacks of opportunity. : Play an asset from your hand, reducing its cost by 3. Resolve a or ability on that asset. After this effect resolves, discard that asset. (If that asset is a weakness, pay as an additional cost.) effect: +1, you may return an asset from you discard pile to your hand.

name: Thor Andersen
InvStoryBack: It all started on a Tuesday. Or rather, it started the first time a Tuesday was followed by a Monday. Then came Thursday. And then came the end of days. Yet somehow, Thor found himself back before those end times. Now, despite not knowing what must be done to prevent it, he knows why.
Text3Back: Neutral cards 0-5. Cards of any two classes 0-5. (You do not need to decide which classes, your deck just needs to be valid at all times.)
Text4Back: 1 Flung Through Time, 1 Chrono Stabilizer, 1 Random Basic Weakness.
Flavor: "Don't worry, this will soon have turned out fine!"
Subtitle: Lost in time
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Text6Back:
Between each scenario, remove any number, at least 10, cards of any class (<see>, <rog>, <gua>, <mys>, <sur>).
You regain all xp spent on those cards.
Cards removed by this effect can never be part of your deck again.
Rules:
<fre> Lose 1 action: Take an immediate action as if it was your turn. (Limit once per round)
<vs>
<eld> effect: +2. If it's currently your turn, another investigator at your location may take an action. Otherwise, you have 1 additional action next turn.

name: Chrono Stabilizer
Rules:
Thor Andersen deck only.
<vs>
<rea> When an investigator at your location would lose any number of actions, exhaust <fullname>: They lose one fewer actions instead.
<vs>
<rea> When an investigator at your location would lose or gain actions: Chose another investigator at your location to gain or lose those actions instead.

name: Flung Through Time
Rules: You must chose one: Future - Move to the location with the most clues closest to you. You have 2 fewer actions next turn. You take 2 damage. Past - Move to the location with the fewest clues farthest from you. Discard 2 cards from you hand. You take 2 horror.

name: The Agency
Text3Back: Guardian cards (<gua>) level 0-5. Seeker cards (<see>) level 0-2.
Subtitle: Collective
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules:
<for> At the beginning of the investigator phase: Search the top 3 cards of the operative deck, choose 2 cards and resolve their Deploy ability.
<vs>
<for> If you have no agents in play, and no cards in the operative deck, you're defeated.

name: Al'ukht Maru
Subtitle: The Other Nun
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules:
<rea> When you reveal a <ble> token, or trigger an ability on an Elder God asset you control: Add 2 <ble> tokens to the chaos bag. (Limit once per phase)
<vs>
<rea> When you reveal a <eld> token: Treat it as a <ble> token instead.
<vs>
<eld> effect: +0. Heal 1 damage or horror from an investigator and ally asset at your location for each <ble> revealed during this test.

name: M1-M1C
Text3Back: Neutral cards level 0-5. Cards of the chosen secondary classes level 0.
Text4Back: Blending In, Mirror Agent, 1 random basic weakness.
Subtitle: Escaped Experiment
Text5Back: During setup, add 5 bonded investigator card to your deck. For every 5 total xp you have you may select 1, the rest is then chosen at random.
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Text6Back: After each scenario ends, until the next scenario, your deckbuilding options includes cards of each class level 0-X, where X is the number of undefeated investigators of that class.
Rules:
<rea> At the start of your turn: Until you use this ability again, gain the printed abilities and base skills of another investigator at your location instead of your own.
<vs>
<eld> effect: 0.

name: Investigators
AccentedStoryA: "Sir, reports indicates that subject M1-M1C is even more elusive than [REDACTED]. Extreme vigilance is required."
RulesA: When you draw an investigator card with a player back, attach the card to your location. Investigator cards attached to locations this way are considered to be investigators for the purpose of player card effects only. (Encounter cards don't interact with them except as noted below) If a investigator card shares location with a ready enemy that is unengaged or massive, at the end of the enemy phase, it takes damage/horror as if that enemy had attacked it. Effects that depends on attacking an actual investigator do not resolve. If an attached investigator card is defeated or discarded it goes to the discard pile.

name: Librarian
Subtitle: Everyday people
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>
Rules:
<rea> When you would draw a card during your turn: Draw an additional card. (Limit once per round)
<ls>
<eld> effect: +2, if this is an investigation test you discover 1 additional clue.

name: Officer
Subtitle: Everyday people

Rules:
<rea> When you would deal damage during your turn: Deal 1 addtional damage. (Limit once per round)
<ls>
<eld> effect: +2, if this is a fight test you may draw 1 card.

name: Con Artist
Subtitle: Everyday people

Rules:
<rea> When you would gain resources during your turn: Gain 1 additional resource. (Limit once per round)
<ls>
<eld> effect: +2, if you succeed by 2 or more, gain 2 resources.

Skill tests you make during the mythos phase gets -1 difficulty.

name: Blending In
Rules: <rea> When you turn begins: You may move an investigator at your location to a connecting location or vice versa. If you move yourself this way, you lose all copied characteristics.

name: Mirror Agent
Rules: During the investigator phase, investigators at <fullname>s location have no printed abilities and -1 to all base skills when it's not their turn.

name: Mai Stoph
Text3Back: Rogue cards () level 0-5. Guardian and Survivor (, ) items level 0-2.

You may grant control of an asset you control to another investigator.
Text4NameBack: Deckbuilding Requirements</hdr> (do not count toward deck size)<hdr>

name: Trickle Down

Subtitle: ... Favors!

name: Campaign
Rules:
<rev> Put <fullname> into your threat area.
<vs>
<for> When your turn begins, grant control of an asset you control to another investigator. If you cannot, take 1 horror.
<vs>
<fre> Spend 1 resource: Place 1 resource on <fullname>. If there are 3<per> resources on <fullname> discard it. Mai Stoph cannot activate this ability.

name: "I'm outta here!"
Keywords: Fast. Play when you would be defeated.
Rules: You Resign. If there's no Resign ability available, instead remove yourself from the game as if you were defeated. When the game ends, you're considered to still be undefeated unless all other investigators are defeated. (In which case you're also defeated.)

name: Dr. Frederiksen.

You get +2 <agi>.

You can get upgraded the "good" vitamins
if you ask the doctor nicely.

name: Corn Flower Dance
Rules: The next time this round you would

name: Pacifist

All player card effects that would affect or initiate fights, do so with investigations instead.
You may test <com> in place of <int> while resolving player effects.
<vs>
You cannot deal damage to enemies.
Enemies you evade does not disengage investigators.

name: Ultimatum of Weariness

name: Boon of Pavlov

<rea> When you turn ends, if you didn't perform a basic Draw action, basic Resource action and no more than 1 basic Move action: Add 1 resource to <fullname>.
<vs>
<rea> When the game ends: For each 4<per> resources on <fullname>, each investigator gains 1 xp.

name: Mary Mathician

Flavor: "People call me cold and calculated. But only the latter is true."
Subtitle: British

X is the number of tokens on <fullname>.

name: Link Masterson

Rules: During an investigation test you are performing, exhaust a tool or weapon you control: You get +1 skill value for this test. +3. You may ready a tool or weapon you control.

name: Family Heirloom
Rules: doesn't ready during upkeep. : Fight. You get +2 for this attack. You may ready to have this attack deal +1 damage. Exhaust : Investigate. You may use instead of for this test.
Flavor: It's said to lead you to your destiny.

name: Ganon
Rules: When the Agenda advances, if is in your discard pile: Shuffle into your deck. If would take any amount of damage, except from an ability on a Relic, reduce that damage to 1.
Flavor:
"Each time the Blood Moon rises
evil will rise again in a new form."

name: Tortoise
Rules:
When you play <fullname>, attach it to your location.
<vs>
Cards attached to Tortoise may be played as if in the hands of any investigator at Tortoise's location.
<vs>
<fre> Attach any number of cards from your hand to <fullname>. Any investigator may trigger this. (limit 3 attached cards).
<vs>
<fre> Exhaust Tortoise: Move tortoise to a connecting location. It does not ready next upkeep. You may use this ability from any location.
Subtitle: He'll get there...

name: Conspiratorial Connection
Rules: Parley. Select an enemy at your location with more remaining health than the shroud value of your location. For each trait that enemy has, discover 1 clue at your location.
Flavor:
"But why would those guys help with...
There's something we're missing..."

name: Deku Mask
Rules:
Treat assets taking up your hand slots as having empty text boxes (except traits).
<vs>
<for>Before another mask enters your play area: Discard <fullname>.
Flavor: The mask seems to inflict its wearer with a lethargic sorrow.
Subtitle: A terrible fate

name: Custom Tommy 9.36
Rules: Discard another copy of from your hand: Replenish all ammo on . Spend 1 ammo: Fight. You get +3 for this fight. If you succeed by 2 or more, you may spend 1 ammo to deal +1 damage.

name: Partner for life
Rules: When you add this card to your deck, choose an ally asset in your deck as your partner. Your partner no longer counts against your deck size and take up no slots. Before drawing your opening hand: Search your deck for your partner and put them into play at your location. When your partner would leave play, remove them from the game instead. Exhaust : Take an action at your partner's location. During this action, movement performed affects your partner instead and damage/horror taken must be assigned to your partner before your investigator card.

name: Quick Witted
Rules:
<fullname> gets <int><agi> for each other copy of <fullname> in your discard pile.
<vs>
After this skill test ends, you may shuffle each other copy of <fullname> in your discard pile into your deck.
